channel.title: SoS | AI, ML, and Web Development studio
channel.description: Recent content on SoS | AI, ML, and Web Development studio

item.title: Stochastic Process Part 1 - Introduction to Stochastic Processes
item.description: In this part 1, we will look at getting a better understanding of a stochastic process, in the next one we will look at some practical implementations to build on this understanding to solve some real-world problems.

item.title: Rediscovering math: How to win a game of shells
item.description: The time I moved out of my school, the image I had of mathematics was of something that you practice a lot to get good scores out of, you remember the “theorems” you see how they are derived if you want that extra edge, it was never something that could help solve real-world problems.

item.title: Lossless soft-deletes with Hasura
item.description: Soft deletes provide the ability to delete records from a database, without actually losing data. It’s like putting data in a recycle bin, so that it is practically deleted, but can still be restored if needed.

item.title: My recent bout with React/Redux boilerplate
item.description: With rise of GraphQL, I often have to work with React Apollo. I personally don’t like apollo for reasons I’ll refrain from discussing in this post.

item.title: THE SOS APP
item.description: An open source project we are building for ourselves. Goal of the project is: To establish transparent communication between software development team To keep the entire team motivated and focused on what we want to achieve To ensure smooth progress so no-one is blocked by someone else on the team (very common in software dev teams) To ensure highest quality of work To gradually build a knowledge base, so team don’t repeat their mistakes, and don’t waste time re-researching same problems The application is 100% conceptualized, designed and developed by our in-house team.
